title: FDA Approves Generic Version of Abortion Pill Mifepristone

summary: In the hours after an attack, a blanket of fear and grief fell over synagogues and Jewish community centers across the country.

summary: Many Orthodox Jews who live in the area reacted with horror to an attack that killed two people and seriously injured three on Yom Kippur, Judaism’s holiest day.

title: What Women Heard in Hegseth’s Remarks About Physical Standards
summary: The defense secretary raised the issue suggesting women were getting into combat not because they met high standards, but because they were given a pass.

summary: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has identified real problems, veteran officers say, but by looking back 35 years for policy cues, he risks hurting, not helping, military readiness.

summary: With the agreement, OpenAI becomes the world’s most valuable privately held company, surpassing the rocket maker SpaceX.

summary: A growing protest movement on the African island, despite deadly clashes with security forces, vows to keep fighting until Andry Rajoelina is ousted.

title: This City Was Forced to Overhaul Its Police Department. Crime Plummeted.

title: Tesla Is Sued by Family Who Says Faulty Cybertruck Doors Led to Woman’s Death
summary: A college student was trapped in a burning Cybertruck because electronic doors made it difficult for her to get out or be rescued, a lawsuit claims.

title: The Big Bad Wolf Is Afraid of You
summary: Researchers found that the predatory canines were far more likely to flee recordings of human voices than they were to run away from other sounds.

title: Democrats Pull Away From AIPAC, Reflecting a Broader Shift
summary: A quiet retreat by Democrats from the pre-eminent pro-Israel lobbying group is the latest evidence of a realignment underway in Congress on Israel.

title: A Candidate Vanished at Sea. His Opponents Insist He Stay on the Ballot.
summary: Petros Krommidas, a Democrat, was running for county legislature on Long Island when he disappeared on a swim. A judge sided with Republicans and refused to allow a replacement candidate.
